results.title: The Flame that freezes
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Electrolux absorption-type refrigerators in the company’s Melbourne factory. Compares old methods of food preservation with those using refrigeration principles. Shows the manufacture of the freezing unit and explains how it operates. Diagrams explain the operation of refrigerators using gas, kerosene and electricity. Summarises the uses of refrigeration in medical services in both city and country.

results.creator_credit: Patrick N Wood and Paul Barralet Productions

results.title: The Five Chinese brothers
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Once upon a time there were five identical Chinese brothers. The first brother could swallow the sea, the second had an iron neck. The third brother could stretch his legs, the fourth could not be burned and the fifth Chinese brother could hold his breath indefinitely. This amusing riddle tells how the five brothers outwit the townspeople and save themselves from a tragic end.

results.title: The Fishermen of Quintay
results.brief_description: The Chilean Government’s decision that life in the isolated fishing villages must be improved brought two visitors - a Chilean Inspector of Fisheries and a UN Fisheries expert to the village of Quintay. The people of this community were anxious for progress, but they could do little to help due to poverty. The UN expert suggested that the fishermen form a co-operative for selling their fish and buying supplies. As a result life in this remote Chilean village has been raised to a new level.

results.title: The Fisherman's boy
results.brief_description: Explains some of the operations of a commercial fishing boat on a large lake. Tells how the captain’s small son learns to fish with a bobber from the dock before he is allowed to accompany his father on the boat.

results.title: The Fish run
results.creator_credit: Jack Howells, Jack Flack and Merlin Films
results.brief_description: The daily 300-mile run of heavy transport lorries carrying fish from Aberdeen to Manchester, filmed against an interesting scenic background. On the occasion recorded in the film, the run takes on an added interest as the lorries are testing a new fuel injector pump en route.

results.title: The First year
results.creator_credit: Barbara A. Chobocky and Documentary Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Tresillian child development series”.
Looks at the important role that fathers can play in the development of their growing child. Centres around three young couples from varied social backgrounds, each with their first child. Suitable for Upper Secondary School students.

results.title: The First World Karate-Do Championship tournament
results.brief_description: Footage of the “First world karate-do Championships Tournament”, including opening ceremony and demonstrations. Presumably held in Japan, c. 1960. Competing countries include: Thailand, Indonesia, States of Brunei, USA, Great Britain, Korea, Canada, Chile, Hon Kong, Israel, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, and many others. 1st, 2nd and 3rd places won by Japan.
